intro: Dissotis ruandensis, commonly known as the Ruanda grass, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale blue florets, which are typical of the genus Dissotis. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
